definition[0]: when a boxer hits his opponent so hard that he falls down and cannot get up again
example[0]: The fight ended in a knockout.
definition[1]: someone or something that is very attractive or successful
definition[2]: a type of competition in which only the winning players or teams at each stage continue to play until there is only one winner
definition[3]: relating to a type of competition in which only the winning players or teams at each stage continue to play
example[2]: Scotlandâ€™s failure to get through the knockout stage of the competition
definition[4]: an arrangement in which people who are trying to buy the same thing agree not to compete against each other on the price
example[3]: It appears to be doubtful whether a knockout was arranged.
